Infrastructure Acceptable Use Policy




Introduction Threat Description IT Access Control –
Individual’s Responsibility Conditions of Use of the Internet Clear desk and screen policy Viruses Monitoring and Filtering Compliance

Introduction

The Infrastructure acceptable use policy covers the security and usage of all The Bulb’s information asset, infrastructure, and any IT equipment. It includes the use of emails, the internet, laptops, and mobile IT equipment, etc.

This policy applies to all clients and other agents of The Bulb (hereafter referred to as individuals).

This policy applies to all information, in whatever form, relating to The Bulb’s business activities worldwide, and to all information handled by The Bulb Africa relating to other organizations with whom it deals. It also covers all IT and information communications facilities operated by The Bulb Africa or on its behalf.

The policy addresses a range of threats:

Threat Description

Copyright Software copied onto a mobile device that could violate licensing or infringement of intellectual property Malware Viruses, Trojans, Worms, Spyware, and other threats that could be introduced via an external device or during surfing. Compliance Loss or theft of financial and/or personal and confidential information/data could expose the organization to the risk of non -compliance with various identity theft and privacy laws.

The addition of new hardware, software, and/or related components to provide additional device connectivity will be managed at the sole discretion of the Systems Admin. Unauthorized use of devices to back up, store, and otherwise access any company’s related information/data is strictly forbidden.

This policy is complementary to any previously implemented policies dealing specifically with data access, data storage, data movement, and connectivity of external devices to any element of The Bulb’s infrastructure.

IT Access Control – Individual’s Responsibility

Access to The Bulb Africa’s IT systems is controlled using Usernames, passwords, and/or tokens. All User IDs and passwords are to be uniquely assigned to named individuals and consequently, individuals are accountable for all actions on The Bulb’s IT systems (laptop, mobile devices, etc.).

Individuals must not:

• Allow anyone else to use their user ID/token and password on any IT system.

• Use someone else’s user ID and password to access The Bulb’s IT systems.

• Leave their password unprotected (for example writing it down).

• Perform any unauthorized changes to IT systems or information.

• Ignore updates or security patch notifications.

• Attempt to access data that they are not authorized to use or access.

• Exceed the limits of their authorization or specific business need to interrogate the system or data.

• Save The Bulb’s data on any non-authorized or personal equipment.

• Give or transfer organizational data or software to any external party without the authority of The Bulb System Admin team.

Conditions of Use of the Internet The use of The Bulb internet is intended for business purposes only. Use of the internet is permitted where such is not detrimental to the organization in any way, not in breach of any term and condition. All individuals are accountable for their activities on the internet systems. Individual must not: • Use profane, obscene, or derogatory remarks in communications. • Access, download, send or receive any data (including images), which the organization considers offensive in any way, including sexually explicit, discriminatory, defamatory, or libellous material. • Use the internet to gamble. • Forward (The Bulb’s) mail to personal email accounts or external parties. • Make official commitments through the internet on behalf of the organization unless authorized to do so. • In any way infringe any copyright, database rights, trademarks, or other intellectual property. • Use the Bulb devices on unsecured internet infrastructure. • Use the Bulb devices or internet to download copyrighted content illegally
) } export default Privacypolicy
